title: Zimbabwe Crush Sri Lanka by 67 Runs in Tri-Series Stunner
byline: Zimbabwe delivered a crushing blow to Sri Lanka on Thursday, sealing their biggest-ever T20I win over the islanders with a commanding 67-run victory in the Pakistan T20I Tri-Series 2025.

title: Wales host Bosnia and NI visit Italy in play-offs
byline: Wales will host Bosnia-Herzegovina while Northern Ireland travel to Italy in the World Cup play-off semi-finals.

title: 'The Ashes is here - now is the time for heroes'
byline: Adelaide is 1,300 miles to the east, Jakarta 1,900 miles to the north. In this corner of Western Australia, nature is hostile. The heat is unforgiving and there are countless animals that could kill a human. Even the magpies attack.

title: Wolff sells £230m stake valuing Mercedes F1 at £4.6bn
byline: Toto Wolff has sold 15% of his shareholding in the Mercedes Formula 1 team to American billionaire George Kurtz.

title: MP Archchuna complains of death threats
byline: Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna today alleged that a certain Muslim MP had threatened him with death at the members’ canteen in Parliament today.

title: Experts sound red alert as Delhi air turns ‘life threatening’
byline: Calling this a ’public health emergency’, experts have said that there is enough evidence to show that pollution hits life expectancy.

title: RTIC warns staffing shortages and media misreporting undermine its functions
byline: The Right to Information Commission of Sri Lanka (RTIC) has expressed serious concern over chronic understaffing, delays in recruitment, and recent media misreporting, which it says undermines its quasi-judicial functions.

title: Mexico’s Fatima Bosch crowned Miss Universe winner in glittering finale of scandal-hit pageant
byline: Fatima Bosch of Mexico has been named Miss Universe 2025 in a scandal-hit competition where she emerged as a fan favorite after she was berated by a Thai pageant director during a live-streamed meeting, triggering a walk out by contestants.

title: Increase in young male elephants linked to rising elephant conflicts: Wildlife Dept.
byline: The number of juvenile (young male elephants) in Sri Lanka has increased over the past three national elephant surveys, contributing to a rise in elephant–elephant conflict, Acting Director General of the Wildlife Conservation Department Ranjan Marasinghe said yesterday.

title: Are NPP-led local bodies in a fix amidst budget defeats?
byline: A series of recent budget defeats across several Pradeshiya Sabhas—many controlled by the governing National People’s Power (NPP), has raised concerns about the stability and functioning of local government bodies.

title: Ex-SJB member arrested in Tangalle drug bust
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy, in a joint operation with the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB), intercepted a fishing vessel carrying narcotics off the southern coast yesterday (November 20). The vessel, along with six local fishermen on board, was brought to Tangalle Fisheries Harbour last evening.

title: Police impose rules on opposition rally sound systems
byline: Police have issued special instructions regarding the use of sound amplification systems at a public rally scheduled for today (November 21) at 2.00 p.m. at the Ananda Samarakoon Open Air Theatre in Nugegoda.

title: Ranil Wickremesinghe leaves for Chennai
byline: Former President and UNP leader Ranil Wickremesinghe departed from Katunayake Airport to Chennai, India, this morning (21), airport officials confirmed.

title: China studying aid project to provide Sri Lanka with electric buses: Ambassador
byline: China is studying an aid project to provide Sri Lanka with a fleet of electric buses, the Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Qi Zhenhong, said yesterday. He noted that this marks a new phase of cooperation between the two countries.

title: Yield-hungry retail rush fuels bourse as risks mount
byline: Sri Lanka’s dramatic decline in interest rates has triggered a massive migration of capital from safe bank deposits to the stock market, prompting regulators and analysts to advise caution as new entrants navigate

title: Sri Lanka-India power grid will be connected through a high voltage line: Minister
byline: The Sri Lankan and Indian power grid will be connected through a high voltage line, Minister of Power and Energy Kumara Jayakody told Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka targets 4.2 billion coconuts in 2026
byline: Sri Lanka’s coconut sector is aiming for a major boost in its annual yield, targeting 4.2 billion high-grade coconuts as part of its production goals.

title: Three killed after 5.7 magnitude quake in Bangladesh
byline: At least three people were killed and several injured after a magnitude 5.7 earthquake struck Bangladesh today.

title: Police remove loudspeakers near Nugegoda exam venue
byline: Several loudspeakers placed around Ananda Samarakoon Open Air Theatre in Nugegoda have been removed by the police, following concerns that the noise could negatively affect students sitting for the A/L examinations.

title: Death toll from Indonesia’s Central Java landslides rises to 30
byline: The death toll from landslides in two regions of Indonesia’s Central Java rose to 30 as rescue efforts continued, the country’s disaster mitigation agency said on Friday.

title: SJB suspends membership of candidate arrested in major drug bust
byline: Opposition and Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) leader Sajith Premadasa said that the party has suspended the membership of a local council candidate arrested in connection with a large narcotics seizure off the southern coast.

title: Spain court orders Meta to compensate media for ’unfair competition’
byline: The potentially landmark decision was centred on European Union law which obliges companies to obtain users’ consent to create lucrative personalised advertising from their data.

title: Kaudulla safari ticket scam: 10 Jeeps seized, wildlife officers suspended
byline: A major ticket fraud operation involving safari jeeps at the Kaudulla National Park has been uncovered, leading to the arrest of several individuals and the seizure of 10 jeeps, Director General of Wildlife Conservation Ranjan Amarasinghe said.

title: Farmers, consumers hit by inaccurate crop data from Agriculture Dept.
byline: Sri Lanka’s farmers and consumers are facing serious difficulties due to inaccurate data and forecasts issued by the Department of Agriculture, Chairman of the National Farmers’ Union Anuradha Tennakoon told the Daily Mirror.

title: MP Mohammed Faizal denies allegation of death threats
byline: MP Mohammed Faizal in Parliament today denied the allegation by MP Ramanathan Archuna that he had threatened the latter with death.

title: Some state institutions will be reactivated with private sector assistance: Deputy Minister
byline: A group of state institutions, including the Kahatagaha Mines, Lanka Mineral Sands and Laksala, will be reactivated with the assistance of the private sector, Deputy Minister of Industries Chathuranga Abeysinghe told Parliament today.

title: More than 5,000 suspects arrested for drug trafficking released on bail, 250 remain in custody
byline: Out of more than 5,000 suspects arrested for drug trafficking, only around 250 have been remanded in custody by the courts, while the remainder have been released on bail, Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Minister Ananda Wijeyapala said.

title: Air rifles to be issued to farmers to control macaque monkeys
byline: The Department of Agriculture has decided to issue air rifles to farmers to protect cultivated land from macaque monkeys, and giant squirrels.

title: Information Department suspends media IDs for non-essential officials
byline: The Department of Information has suspended the issuance of media identity cards to media secretaries of ministers and officials of government institutions.

title: Appeal Court affirms death sentences of five convicted over 152 kg heroin haul
byline: The Court of Appeal today upheld the death sentences imposed on five individuals convicted of trafficking 151.341 kilograms of heroin in 2019, a consignment that was at the time the largest narcotic stock ever detected by the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: Grade 6 school cut-off marks for 2026 released
byline: The Education Ministry has announced the Grade 6 school cut-off marks for 2026 admissions, based on the results of the 2025 Grade Five Scholarship Examination.

title: PM highlights the importance of education
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said that education has the power to bring people together socially, politically, and economically, while allowing knowledge to be shared.

title: Power cut hits Joint Opposition rally
byline: The Power supply breakdown was reported at the Joint Oppotition rally started which started in Nugegoda a short while ago.

title: Pro-govt. groups hang grass bundles implying participants are ’buffaloes’
byline: Pro-government groups have hung bundles of grass in several areas around Dehiwala and Kohuwala, claiming that “only buffaloes” will attend the Joint Opposition public rally scheduled to be held in Nugegoda today.

title: Gomarankadawala PS Chairman dies
byline: Chairman of the Gomarankadawala Pradeshiya Sabha, Ranga Prabath Dharmadasa, has died following an illness.

title: SC orders fresh inquiry into alleged deception of 22 Sri Lankan drivers sent to Dubai
byline: The Supreme Court directed the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) to immediately commence a fully fledged inquiry into complaints filed by 22 Sri Lankan drivers who alleged they were deceived after being sent for employment in Dubai.

title: Nugegoda ’brown sugar’ outlet becomes hot topic in Parliament
byline: Amid various criticisms on the recently opened ’brown sugar’ outlet in Nugegoda, Deputy Minister of Industries Chaturanga Abeysinghe said the outlet has recorded sales exceeding Rs. 800,000 for nine days.
